Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Earring
Description: The earring is circular with a triangular cross section. The edge is crenellated and emphasised on both surfaces by an incised line, just at the edge of the ridge. The circle is interrupted along approximately 0,2 cm. The earring's exterior diametre is 2,15 cm. The diametre of the central opening is 1,1 cm and its thickness is 0,75 cm.This is a type of earring that is frequently found in New Kingdom tombs and several parallels can be made with this object: see L 2337, L 2457.
